identificationModule.briefTitle: Effectiveness of a Neuromuscular Exercise Program and Visual Feedback in the Management of Body Position for Stroke Survivors
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effectiveness of a Neuromuscular Exercise Program and Visual Feedback in the Management of Body Position During Standing and Walking for Patients With Stroke During the Second Stage of Rehabilitation

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The aim of the biomedical research is to evaluate the changes of body position management during standing and walking for stroke patients, using innovative training methods during the rehabilitation.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Two study groups, 60 patients per group. Patients will be randomly assigned to first of second study group.

armGroups.label: First Group
armGroups.description: Neuromuscular exercise program with standard physiotherapy with no visual feedback.

armGroups.label: Second Group
armGroups.description: Neuromuscular exercise program with physiotherapy with visual feedback using Biodex platform
interventionNames: Device: Biodex Balance SD and Biodex Gait Trainer

interventions.name: Standard physiotherapy
interventions.description: Neuromuscular exercise program with standard physiotherapy with no visual feedback

interventions.name: Biodex Balance SD and Biodex Gait Trainer
interventions.description: Neuromuscular exercise program with physiotherapy with visual feedback using Biodex platform

primaryOutcomes.description: Testing key muscles from the lower and upper extremities against the examiner's resistance and grading the patient's strength on a 0 (No contraction) to 5 (Movement against gravity with full resistance) scale.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Gait and Balance testing by Berg Scale
primaryOutcomes.description: The Berg balance scale is used to objectively determine a patient's ability (or inability) to safely balance during a series of predetermined tasks. It consists of 14 items scored on an ordinal scale of 0 to 4 for a total of 56 points (a higher score indicates lower fall risk).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Timed Stand Up and Go Test
primaryOutcomes.description: subjects are asked to rise from a standard armchair, walk to a marker 3 m away, turn, walk back, and sit down again. 314. The test is a reliable and valid test for quantifying functional mobility that may also be useful in following clinical change over time.
This scale contains 9 statements that are designed to evaluate the internal and external beliefs regarding the traumatic events that the patient has experienced.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Limits of Stability Testing with Biodex SD (score)
secondaryOutcomes.description: During test, patients must shift their weight to move the cursor from the center target to a colored target and back as quickly and with as little deviation as possible. Platform Setting- static. Direction control - overall. Faster and accurately- better.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline - before enrolling 4 week training program and after 4 week training

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Risk of Fall Testing with Biodex SD (score)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Test results are compared to age dependent normative data. Platform Setting - static. Test Trial Time 30 seconds in four positions: eyes opened narrow stance, eyes closed narrow stance, eyes opened closed feet stance, eyes closed stance. Patient's aged 54-71 years' normative scores are 0.9-3.7 scores, 72-89 years' normative scores are 2-4 scores, 36-53 years' normative scores are 0.7-3.1 scores, 17-35 years' normative scores are 0.7-2.1 scores. Change from baseline indicates a fall risk by scores.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline - before enrolling 4 week training program and after the whole training

secondaryOutcomes.description: Stance phase analysis (stance parameters and forces) - average load distribution under the feet is displayed in color. The color scale enables the load distribution to be quantified. The central point's show the centers of pressure (COP) over the time. The left and right points are the respective centers of pressure of the left and right contact areas. The area of the displayed confidence ellipse contains 95% of the COP's measuring points.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline - before enrolling 4 week training program and after 4 week training
